line.comment: * triggered by Mayhem.Monitor.Galaxy. Default diplo update cycle is 4-5 hours
* we randomize so that if the player is vassal to multiple factions during Warlord Challenge not always the same faction gets tribute from player first (diminishing amounts)
* get data
* update War Duration
* set to war status if player caused negative rep during last cycle
* the Warlord challenge only allows ending 5 wars during the entire playthrough. Afterwards every war turns into a permanent war

line.text: ' has started a permanent war against you!'

line.comment: * grows while at war
* set to peace status if player repaired his rep during last cycle
* shrinks while at peace
* check if vassal breaks free from player master

line.text: ' has started a permanent war against you!'

line.comment: * check if player vassal broke his contract

line.text: ' has started a permanent war against you!'

line.comment: * **PEACE***(positive vanilla reputation)
* consider declaring war against player
* less chance if last war was not long ago
* first about half day of peacetime
* $t = '(debug) ' + $race + ' rolled for war against player with rng 1 to ' + $RiskReduction
* write to player logbook $t
* passive Motivation growth after reaching Motivation threshold (Warlord Mode: always active after conquering 1st sector!)
* **AT WAR***(negative vanilla reputation)
* **calculating peace offer for next cycle. Peace cost: 0=white peace, negative=no offer, positive=reparations, 'createVassal'=capitulation
* never offer any peace before at least 1 full war cycle has passed
* peace base cost is 300k credits per player owned sector
* after ~2 days of war there is 20% chance to get a white peace offer
* after ~18h of war peace cost starts to go down by 10% on each cycle
* at this point there is a 1% chance to get a white peace

* during first ~18h in a war peace cost gets randomly up to 30% more expensive and there is 40% additional chance to get no peace offer at all. None of this happens if player has only very little bad reputation.
* lowest rank of vanilla reputation always makes reparations 50% more expensive +25% risk to get no peace offer
* having only little bad rep makes reparations cheap + 5% additional chance to get early white peace offer
* enemy Motivation at 0 halves reparation demands and has additional 25% chance to offer a white peace
* each point of motivation increases peace cost by 0,25%
* if we end up with any remaining peace cost, randomness follows up
* faction can always still randomly act stubborn, not offering any peace when they actually should
* otherwise they slightly randomize actual cost for each new peace offer
* if final peace cost ends up laughably low we round it down into a white peace offer
* extremely long war of ~4 days or more guarantees white peace
* at war against a smaller NPC empire
* enemy passively looses current Motivation relative to 5 times the size difference in %
* loss is always at least the absolute 5 times size difference
* Capitulation, becoming a vassal to player
* Tutorial
* check if an active operation must be aborted
* abort if player repaired his rep since last cycle or if sector became unknown or Sith
* during preparation phase we abort if we don't have at least 2 remaining member BG
* after the go code we only abort after every member got killed
* ** Attempt new Coordinated Invasion ***
* ** first check vs. Player with small risk to even try, but it tries every sector
* flat risk from permanent war 3% to only target dejure sectors 1% vs. every sector
* 25% chance to fake a dejure status to enable standard sector as valid target
* War Motivation based risk, 0,25% per point above 100
* 25% chance to fake a dejure status to enable standard sector as valid target
* **then vs. NPCs (each faction always tries against 1 completely random non-player sector. Fails very often when its not the required dejure or not claimable.)
* 50% chance to fake a dejure status to enable any sector as valid target
* lastly apply pending Motivation reductions (to take effect at next cycle). All increases already got applied before this cycle with Mayhem.Diplomacy.Motivation
* stops if it started an operation (found a player sector that has enough enemy BGs in range)

triggered by Mayhem.Monitor.Galaxy. Default diplo update cycle is 4-5 hours
we randomize so that if the player is vassal to multiple factions during Warlord Challenge not always the same faction gets tribute from player first (diminishing amounts)
get data
update War Duration
set to war status if player caused negative rep during last cycle
the Warlord challenge only allows ending 5 wars during the entire playthrough. Afterwards every war turns into a permanent war
grows while at war
set to peace status if player repaired his rep during last cycle
shrinks while at peace
check if vassal breaks free from player master
check if player vassal broke his contract
**PEACE***(positive vanilla reputation)
consider declaring war against player
less chance if last war was not long ago
first about half day of peacetime
$t = '(debug) ' + $race + ' rolled for war against player with rng 1 to ' + $RiskReduction
write to player logbook $t
passive Motivation growth after reaching Motivation threshold (Warlord Mode: always active after conquering 1st sector!)
**AT WAR***(negative vanilla reputation)
**calculating peace offer for next cycle. Peace cost: 0=white peace, negative=no offer, positive=reparations, 'createVassal'=capitulation
never offer any peace before at least 1 full war cycle has passed
peace base cost is 300k credits per player owned sector
after ~2 days of war there is 20% chance to get a white peace offer
after ~18h of war peace cost starts to go down by 10% on each cycle
at this point there is a 1% chance to get a white peace

during first ~18h in a war peace cost gets randomly up to 30% more expensive and there is 40% additional chance to get no peace offer at all. None of this happens if player has only very little bad reputation.
lowest rank of vanilla reputation always makes reparations 50% more expensive +25% risk to get no peace offer
having only little bad rep makes reparations cheap + 5% additional chance to get early white peace offer
enemy Motivation at 0 halves reparation demands and has additional 25% chance to offer a white peace
each point of motivation increases peace cost by 0,25%
if we end up with any remaining peace cost, randomness follows up
faction can always still randomly act stubborn, not offering any peace when they actually should
otherwise they slightly randomize actual cost for each new peace offer
if final peace cost ends up laughably low we round it down into a white peace offer
extremely long war of ~4 days or more guarantees white peace
at war against a smaller NPC empire
enemy passively looses current Motivation relative to 5 times the size difference in %
loss is always at least the absolute 5 times size difference
Capitulation, becoming a vassal to player
check if an active operation must be aborted
abort if player repaired his rep since last cycle or if sector became unknown or Sith
during preparation phase we abort if we don't have at least 2 remaining member BG
after the go code we only abort after every member got killed
** Attempt new Coordinated Invasion ***
** first check vs. Player with small risk to even try, but it tries every sector
flat risk from permanent war 3% to only target dejure sectors 1% vs. every sector
25% chance to fake a dejure status to enable standard sector as valid target
War Motivation based risk, 0,25% per point above 100
25% chance to fake a dejure status to enable standard sector as valid target
**then vs. NPCs (each faction always tries against 1 completely random non-player sector. Fails very often when its not the required dejure or not claimable.)
50% chance to fake a dejure status to enable any sector as valid target
lastly apply pending Motivation reductions (to take effect at next cycle). All increases already got applied before this cycle with Mayhem.Diplomacy.Motivation
stops if it started an operation (found a player sector that has enough enemy BGs in range)
